title: Inconsistent deps for spring-web based app when using code.quarkus versus command line tooling

labels.name: area/spring
labels.description: Issues relating to the Spring integration

labels.name: area/devtools
labels.description: Issues/PR related to maven, gradle, platform and cli tooling/plugins

body:
### Describe the bug

Inconsistent deps for spring-web based app when using code.quarkus versus command line tooling.

https://code.quarkus.io/?e=spring-web based application uses
```xml
    <dependency>
      <groupId>io.quarkus</groupId>
      <artifactId>quarkus-resteasy-jackson</artifactId>
    </dependency>
```

`quarkus create app app -x=quarkus-spring-web` based application uses
```xml
    <dependency>
      <groupId>io.quarkus</groupId>
      <artifactId>quarkus-resteasy-reactive-jackson</artifactId>
    </dependency>
```

I think `quarkus-resteasy-reactive-jackson` should be used in code.quarkus
`quarkus-resteasy-reactive-jackson` is defined in https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/main/independent-projects/tools/base-codestarts/src/main/resources/codestarts/quarkus/extension-codestarts/spring-web-codestart/codestart.yml#L19



### Expected behavior

Consistent deps (quarkus-resteasy-reactive-jackson) for spring-web based app when using code.quarkus versus command line tooling.


### Actual behavior

Inconsistent deps for spring-web based app when using code.quarkus versus command line tooling.


### How to Reproduce?

_No response_

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

_No response_

### Output of `java -version`

Java 17

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

2.9.2.Final

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)
